result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Frank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 4 days served, if probation is revoked.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  **Pay fine of $ 350.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason L. Frank

records.addlTxt: Rec'd check #16CH075803 back from USPS - not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward
Bond applied; partial refund;  gb /mg   ck#16CH075803
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frederick Zievers.  Clerk  K. Zirbel.  Sentenced to six years WSP.  Initial confinement: 3 years.  Extended supervision:  3 years.  SENTENCE IS STAYED, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Credit for 4 days served if probation is revoked.  $1,000 cash bond to apply to fine and costs due; any excess may be returned to the poster.  No restitution due.  Firearms and voting warnings given.
With Atty Zievers and ADA Phan, and by agreement of the court, the SEH of 1/6/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, Atty Zievers is waiting to obtain information from deft; reset to 2/1/16 at 3:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, the SEH is adjourned to 1/6/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
With Diane/Atty Zievers the SEH of 12/2/15 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 12/4/15 at 10am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 12/2/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Prior: 109 N. Walbash Street, Hobart, IN 46342 United States

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frederick Zievers.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Zievers requests time to determine the value of #2 scrap copper at the time of the offense.  FPT 9/28/15 at 1:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Zievers states he received a squad cam that he believes demonstrates the stop that led to the deft's arrest, ADA McNeill has not had time to review it, has received an offer today that he needs time to discuss w/deft.  FPT continued to 8/19/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill states she just received followup on Monday that contains a squad video and photos that Atty Zievers may not have yet.  FPT continued to 7/30/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
Appearance Notice

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Zievers appeared early and requested continued hearing date as he needs to be in court in Racine.  FPT adjourned to 7/8/15 at 8:15am; deft advised to go to Atty Zievers office from court.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Zievers states there have been discussions w/ADA and believes additional investigation would have value.  ADA McNeill states she believes they can reach a compromise by the end of May.  FPT continued to 6/16/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Fred Zievers. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 3-20-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 3-27-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.

Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Def. left VM for clerk on 7-23-14 to inquire about voluntary appearance. Clerk called back and discussed how to arrange voluntary appearance with def. Def. advised he is in the process of hiring attorney and will call back to schedule voluntary appearance.
Warrant to be re-issued. Subject was in custody in PA and was released.
